pair.Prompt: What was the case of United States v. E. C. Knight Co.?
pair.Response: Response: United States v. E. C. Knight Co. was a Supreme Court case decided on October Term, 1894. The case involved a challenge to the act of 1890, which subjected to forfeiture any property owned under any contract or by any combination, or pursuant to any conspiracy, and being in the course of transportation from one State to another, or to a foreign country. In his dissenting opinion, Justice Harlan argued that Congress had the authority to suppress combinations that unlawfully restrain interstate trade and commerce.
